author: VinInn
body:
This PR introduces two new types of hits: inactive_inner and inactive_outer.
With minimal changes (mostly forced by the compiler error on "missing case in switch" they are propagated to HitPattern as "inactive" for MISSING_INNER/_OUTER categories respectively.

No regression is expected as clients modified to count just "missing (aka lost)".
I have added a new set of efficiency histos in DQM where inactive (all inactive) are now counted in the denominator.

(mind, it triggers the recompilation of the universe)

To make "regression safe" the interface of HitPattern some additional changes have been introduced.
To summarize

to count all hits in a category (independent of their type) now use
```numberOfAllHits(category)``` instead of ```numberOfHits(category)```

For the specific MISSING_INNER/_OUTER categories:
to count only the "missing (aka) lost" hits use
```numberOfLostHits(category)```
to count only the "inactive" hits (added with this PR) use
```trackerLayersTotallyOffOrBad(category)```

Note that for MISSING_INNER/_OUTER categories now:
```numberOfAllHits(category) == numberOfLostHits(category)+trackerLayersTotallyOffOrBad(category)```


before this PR for  MISSING_INNER/_OUTER categories instead this other equality was true (and exploited)
```numberofHits(category) == numberofLostHits(category)```

```numberOfHits``` has been obsoleted, so code that still invoke it should not compile or produce equivalent error message if root-macro/python

needless to say that all code invoking ```numberofHits``` present in the repository (including root-macro/python) has been migrated to call either ```numberOfAllHits(category)``` or ```numberOfLostHits(category)``` to reproduce the previous behavior (no regression)
release-notes: after introduction of inactive hits to inner and outer parts of the HitPattern, the HitPattern interface was updated, including removal of an existing [now ambiguous] method in order to avoid incorrect result. See PR description for details.
title: Introducing "Inactive" inner/outer hits...
